thread.title: How did Devon's MPs vote on the Brexit Repeal Bill? Search by name or constituency following the major vote

author: Rom Preston-Ellis
title: How did Devon's MPs vote on the Brexit Repeal Bill? Search by name or constituency following the major vote
text:
How did Devon's MPs vote on the Brexit Repeal Bill? Search by name or constituency following the major vote Here's how every MP voted on the important Brexit legislation Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Comments 
Devon's MPs were in Westminster last night to vote on crunch Brexit legislation. 
The House sat long beyond midnight for the vote, which saw the bill pass its first Parliamentary hurdle by 36 votes, 326-290. 
The Bill shifts existing EU laws on to the UK statue book to give businesses and citizens certainty for when Britain leaves the bloc, reports the Mirror. 
But Jeremy Corbyn labelled it “a power grab by the Government at the expense of our democratically elected Parliament”. 
Opponents of the bill argued it included loopholes which would allow ministers to meddle with laws without the full scrutiny of parliament using "Henry VIII" powers. 
So how did your MP vote on the Brexit Repeal Bill? 
Tory MPs were told to vote in favour of the Bill, and Labour MPs were told to vote against. 
Not one Tory MP voted against the Bill - but seven Labour MPs voted in favour. 
They were all known Brexit-backers: Ronnie Campbell
